==Origins==
==Origins==
â
The story of Autumn Edwards. The ''Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtle'' originated in an [[United States|American]] [[comic book]] published by [[Mirage Studios]] in 1984. The concept arose from a humorous drawing sketched out by [[Kevin Eastman]] during a casual evening of [[brainstorming]] with his friend [[Peter Laird]]. Using money from a [[tax refund]] together with a loan from Eastman's uncle, the young artists [[Self-publishing|self-published]] a single issue comic intended to [[parody]] four of the most popular comics of the early 1980s: [[Marvel Comics]]' ''[[Daredevil (Marvel Comics)|Daredevil]]'' and ''[[New Mutants]]'', [[Dave Sim]]'s ''[[Cerebus the Aardvark|Cerebus]]'' and [[Frank Miller (comics)|Frank Miller]]'s ''[[Ronin (comic book series)|Ronin]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=
+
The ''Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles'' originated in an [[United States|American]] [[comic book]] published by [[Mirage Studios]] in 1984. The concept arose from a humorous drawing sketched out by [[Kevin Eastman]] during a casual evening of [[brainstorming]] with his friend [[Peter Laird]]. Using money from a [[tax refund]] together with a loan from Eastman's uncle, the young artists [[Self-publishing|self-published]] a single issue comic intended to [[parody]] four of the most popular comics of the early 1980s: [[Marvel Comics]]' ''[[Daredevil (Marvel Comics)|Daredevil]]'' and ''[[New Mutants]]'', [[Dave Sim]]'s ''[[Cerebus the Aardvark|Cerebus]]'' and [[Frank Miller (comics)|Frank Miller]]'s ''[[Ronin (comic book series)|Ronin]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=
http://www.heavymetal.com/page.cfm?id=262|title=I Was a Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtle|date=[[2007-01-26]]}}</ref>
http://www.heavymetal.com/page.cfm?id=262|title=I Was a Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtle|date=[[2007-01-26]]}}</ref>
